blocks.text:
The sum curve for AB is the curve CD, the last ordinate of which, measured according to the figure, passes through $x = 1$ and $x = 2$, and the base line touches $y = 025$; and hence the full under the curve AB = $-0095$-area of a rectangle $025 	imes 1$, if $-0095$ or $0345.$ 

Thus,

blocks.description: This integral calculates the area under the sum curve between $x = 1$ and $x = 2$.

blocks.text: $y$ is given as the sum curve polar distance = $-  rac{1}{2} \log \left( \frac{x^{2}+4}{x+3} \right)$.

blocks.description: This derivative is found using the logarithmic differentiation method.
This is the resulting integral of the function.

blocks.caption: Graphical Integration of Example 21
blocks.description: The graph shows the curve AB, indicating the area computed under the sum curve and demonstrating integration through geometrical interpretation.
